data.title: Neue Galerie New York (New York)
data.meta_description: Neue Galerie New York is a museum in New York. View visitor information, information about the collection and read reviews.
data.text:
The Neue Galerie New York is a museum dedicated to early twentieth-century German and Austrian art and design. It is situated in the William Starr Miller House at 86th Street and Fifth Avenue in New York City. This location is part of the city's renowned Museum Mile, making it easily accessible for tourists and art enthusiasts.

Collection of Neue Galerie New York

The Neue Galerie's collection is split into two sections. The second floor showcases fine art and decorative art from early twentieth-century Austria, featuring works by renowned artists such as Gustav Klimt, Oskar Kokoschka, and Egon Schiele, as well as decorative pieces by the artisans of the Wiener Werkstaette. The third floor displays various German works from the same period, including pieces from art movements like Der Blaue Reiter (The Blue Rider), Die Br√ºcke (The Bridge), and the Bauhaus.
